Class Prey

java.lang.Object
org.wildloop.Animal
org.wildloop.Prey
public class Prey extends Animal
Represents prey in the simulation. Prey flees from Predator objects within a specified range and gains energy through grazing.
See Also:
  • Animal
  • Predator

  • Constructor Details

    • Prey

      public Prey(Position position, int energy, int maxAge)
      Creates new prey.
      Parameters:
      position - initial position of the prey
      energy - initial energy of the prey
      maxAge - maximum age the prey can reach

  • Method Details

    • getNextMoveDirection

      protected Direction getNextMoveDirection()
      Determines direction of prey's next move. If a predator is within FLEE_RANGE, prey flees in opposite direction. Otherwise, chooses a random direction.
      Specified by:
      getNextMoveDirection in class Animal
      Returns:
      direction in which prey should move

    • findNearestPredator

      private Predator findNearestPredator()
      Finds the nearest predator within prey's detection range.
      Returns:
      nearest predator or null if none is within range

    • eat

      protected void eat()
      Allows prey to graze, increasing its energy by GRAZE_ENERGY_GAIN.
      Specified by:
      eat in class Animal

    • createOffspring

      protected Animal createOffspring(Position position)
      Creates a new prey as offspring.
      Specified by:
      createOffspring in class Animal
      Parameters:
      position - position for the new prey
      Returns:
      new prey object with initial energy equal to Animal.OFFSPRING_ENERGY
